column4: Hi, I've installed ubuntu, but the networking isn't working. How do I set up my machine to get its IP via DHCP?

Ah, this brings us to another fun part. I do System -> Administration -> Networking, and I get the "working" mouse icon for 5 seconds, and then it's the pointer again and I'm back to square one. What gives?
In fact, I think clicking on anything under administration does that. Do I have to somehow login as root (which I didn't think was allowed/possible)
dpkg-reconfigure for some package should allow you this configuration too
I'm a nitwit. Please speak to me accordingly.
it's the console interface for the configuration. i'll go look for the magic word
Heck with it. I'll just reinstall.
fantastic, it just wasn't configured or enabled
still, not having the administration menu working is a big bug. maybe someone at ##gnome will know something about it
Oh. I thought I just misconfigured something
